column4: Hey folks, I was running 8.10 workstation on my laptop for some time with no issues at all. Due to some unexpected circumstances I ended up reinstalling with the only disk I could find a link to, 9.04. Problem is, I have problems in a few areas of importance. One I can't seem to install OpenVZ kernels -- which is a deal killer for me since I require it for work. Two, I had to revert my Intel video drivers just to get video to work, and three wh
Where can I find a link to 8.10 again, or is this completely dropped now?
Or if someone can point me to working instructions for openvz + 9.04 I wouldn't mind staying with the system I've got right now.
same here. 8.10 was much better on my laptop than 8.04

see, nothing but problems since, I tried to install downthemall in firefox 3.0 and FF hung. Now my download window is all screwed up. Now I tried to open that link you gave me and it says firefox is not responding (it is to me) and will need to be restarted. Sillyness.
you need a direct link to the 8.10 desktop torrent file?
I would love that, can start from CLI then
figures I wait for google when it's right under my nose ;)
I don't normally use wget, although I use CLI a lot
